document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the genus Chilocorus Leach, 1815 (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae: Chilocorini), with descriptions of two new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the genus Chilocorus Leach, 1815 (Coleoptera: Coccinellidae: Chilocorini), with descriptions of two new species from China

emphasis.emphasis: Key to species of the genus

keyStep.keyLead:
– Dorsum with bluish lustre ( Fig. 3a ) ........................................
C. nigricaeruleus Li & Wang
sp. nov.

6. Pronotum mostly black except lateral parts yellow ( Fig. 4c ) .................
C. nigrita ( Fabricius, 1798 )

– Pronotum black except anterior angles yellow ( Fig. 5c ) ..................................
C. melas Weise, 1898

paragraph.keyLead:
9. Scutellum black ( Fig. 7 a–c); abdominal postcoxal line not reaching posterior margin of abdominal ventrite 1 ( Fig. 7d ) ................................................................................
C. chinensis Miyatake, 1970

– Scutellum red ( Fig. 8 a–c); abdominal postcoxal line reaching posterior margin of abdominal ventrite 1 ( Fig. 8d ) ........................................................................................
C. rufitarsis Motschulsky, 1853

– Head and pronotum yellow, outer margin of elytra black without bluish lustre ( Fig. 10 ac) ...................................................................................................
C. circumdatus ( Gyllenhal, 1808 )

keyStep.keyLead:
13. Penis guide as long as parameres ( Fig. 11h ) .......................................
C. chalybeatus Gorham, 1892

– Penis guide distinctly shorter than parameres (
Fig. 12g
) .............................
C. shirozui Sasaji, 1968

– Penis and tegmen strongly stout, penis guide subtriangular, widest at base, gradually converging apically to blunted tip in ventral view ( Fig. 14e, h ) ....................
C. strenotubus Li & Wang
sp. nov.

paragraph.keyLead:
16. Penis guide approximately ¾ length of parameres in lateral view, distinctly expanded at basal ¼ in ventral view ( Fig. 15 g–h) .........................................................................
C. kuwanae Silvestri, 1909

– Penis guide approximately 4/5 length of parameres in lateral view, approximately parallel from base to basal ½ ( Fig. 16 g–h) ..................................................................................
C . esakii
Kamiya, 1959

19. Body length: 3.33–3.67 mm , elytra dark brown, with three pairs of roundish yellow spots, arranged in a row before centre, penis guide as long as parameres ( Fig. 19a, g ) .............................................. .......................................................................................................
C . bipustulatus
( Linnaeus, 1758 )

– Body length: 3.80–4.67 mm , elytra dark brown, with a pair of transverse yellow strips, situated before centre, about ¾ elytra width, penis guide slightly longer than parameres ( Fig. 20a, g ) ...........................................................................................................
C . geminus
Zaslavskij, 1962
